summary: Completed comprehensive testing of client-to-provider messaging flow. All backend APIs (14/14 tests) and frontend flows working correctly.
passed_tests: Backend: POST /api/auth/login - successful login with valid credentials
Backend: POST /api/auth/login - returns 401 for invalid credentials
Backend: GET /api/auth/me - returns 401 without authentication
Backend: GET /api/providers - returns list of providers with user_id
Backend: GET /api/providers/{provider_id} - returns provider with user_id field
Backend: GET /api/providers/{provider_id} - returns 404 for invalid ID
Backend: GET /api/users/{user_id} - returns user info when authenticated
Backend: GET /api/users/{user_id} - returns 401 without authentication
Backend: GET /api/users/{user_id} - returns 404 for invalid user
Backend: POST /api/messages - sends message successfully
Backend: POST /api/messages - returns 401 without authentication
Backend: GET /api/messages/conversations - returns conversation list
Backend: GET /api/messages/{user_id} - returns messages with user
Backend: Complete contact provider flow integration test
Frontend: Homepage loads correctly
Frontend: Search page displays provider cards with data-testid
Frontend: Login flow works with email/password
Frontend: Provider card expands on click showing details
Frontend: 'Contacter' button visible for authenticated users
Frontend: 'Contacter' button redirects to /messages?provider={provider_id}
Frontend: Messages page auto-selects provider from URL parameter
Frontend: Messages can be sent and appear in conversation
Frontend: Unauthenticated users see login prompt on provider card
Frontend: Phone number blurred for unauthenticated users
seed_data_creation: Used existing sample data created by create_sample_data.py
context_for_next_testing_agent: Messaging flow from provider card to messages page is fully functional. Test user client@test.com/password123 has existing conversations with provider user_sample_001 (Pierre Martin). Backend tests in /app/backend/tests/test_messaging_flow.py cover all messaging endpoints.
